review_blob:
This was a little too much on the sweet malty bready side. Almost like a hop slam without a fraction of the hops. Not bad but doubt ill buy it again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Fort Collins The Incredible Hop - Imperial India Pale Ale

review_blob:
A: Grass and Barnyard funk. Strong Alcohol. Lemon zest.

A: Copper with a fluffy head that disappears after a minutes. Minimal lacing

T: Dry, Dry, Dry. Some Alcohol present, grass, vegetal notes, hay and lemon. Mildly peppery.

P: Rather thin. High carbonation as expected.

O: Not a bad beer. Suits the style but doesnt go above and beyond. Worth a shot.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada / Russian River BRUX Domesticated Wild Ale

review_blob:
Good beer, Pours dark like a Porter or Stout with a nice creamy tan head that lingers. Smells like a chocalatey IPA, nice even heavy hop and heavy malt character

Tastes hoppy and chocolates, some bready notes. Some sweetness with mild coffee. Really nice.

A little on the watery side, but it holds up to its other characteristics

A good beer thru and thru.
beer_name: Hoppin Frog Hop Heathen Imperial Black Ale

review_blob:
Pours hazy orangish yellow, with a creamy 2 finger head. Looks really nice.

Smell is citrus and malt. Some pine notes show thru as well.

Citrus and Pine all the way, followed by some light crusty bread notes. Finish nice and dry, perfect balance of bitter and malt.

 Crisp and refreshing, not to boozy, but it does show through a little.

 Great IPA. One of my top 5 beers.

This beer pours a straw yellow with a small fluffy head and minimal lacing. He disipates after a while.

The nose on this one has an odd funkiness too it, its really hard to explain I almost want to say metallic funk. Apples are present as well.

Taste is slightly sour with a huge apple flavor. Think sour apple jolly rancher and you have a good idea. Personally I enjoyed it, probably wont be for all though.

Crisp and refreshing, definetely a good summertime brew.

Overall I enjoyed it as I enjoy almost all of Lindemans offerings.
